website_summaries.verdict: A tough, well-built wire cutter with heavy-duty forged steel blades and handles, meant for cutting softer wire rope up to 1/4'' or smaller harder items.
pros: This tool provides plenty of leverage and cuts wire rope up to 1/4" thick
cons: It cuts softer metals such as wire rope up to 1/4" thick, but can only handle harder items that are a bit smaller than that

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. This cutter has impressed me.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-designed and well-made tool. These are actually made in Japan, too. Excellent. This cutter has impressed me. In my opinion, it's cheap considering the quick work it makes of cutting hard cable and wire. I have had it for about 8 months now and cut a variety of materials, from steel cable to copper to wire coat hangers. It has had no problem cutting anything that will fit within its jaws. Which is one, small draw-back. The jaws don't open very wide. See the attached photo to see it fully opened with a penny for scale. I will buy another when this one wears out, which should be a long time from now.
customer_reviews.author: Ocelot

customer_reviews.title: Less than 20-25 cuts.. Buyers Beware
customer_reviews.text: Buyers beware!! I’ve had this February or March of this year. Used it on 3/32 galvanized wire rope. Didn’t last long. I used this a few times in February and March, used it today 4 times , on the 5th try, it wouldn’t cut clean through the wire. I wouldn’t buy it but that’s my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: marc d. jackson

customer_reviews.title: So glad I finally invested in a set of nice cutters
customer_reviews.text: These are really well constructed wire cutters. So glad I finally invested in a set of nice cutters. Used them along with the following to hang guide lines for bistro lights. But these will last a long time for other projects. *Koch 002023 1/16 by 500-Feet 7 by 7 Cable , Galvanized (ASIN: B00775PDN0) *GLE2016 10Pcs Stainless Steel 2mm 1/16 Inch Wire Rope Clip Cable Clamp Fastener Silver Tone (ASIN: B01N40M501) *Loos Cableware AN100-C3 10 Piece Stainless Steel Thimble for 3/64", 1/16" and 3/32" Diameter Wire Rope (ASIN: B0038YY3LC) *BQLZR M4 Stainless Steel 304 Hook & Eye Turnbuckle Wire Rope Tension Pack Of 5 (ASIN: B00IJ67MKI) *Greenlee 722 Wire Rope & Wire Cutter (ASIN: B00125KG9C)
customer_reviews.author: George C.

customer_reviews.title: Finally a cutter that actually works right!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a couple other cable cutters from various sources on Amazon.com and this is the only one that I have found which works as advertised. It cuts 1/8 cable cleanly without frays and the handles are long enough to reduce the cutting efforts. I have completed about 100 cable cuttings so far and the cutter works the same as the first cut. We shall see how long it stays as a precision cutter but I do have high hopes. I would definitely recommend this cutter over the 3 other cutters that I have tried. Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Greenlee 722 Wire Rope Cutter
customer_reviews.text: I use these Greenlee 722 cutters mainly for things like 1/8" coated steel wire rope [3/16" O.D. overall] to make tie out leads for our two dogs and for smaller cables used for bicycle brake and derailleur shift cables. The cutter blades are sharp and make very nice clean cuts that leave no frayed wire strands. The handles are vinyl dipped and contoured, so are reasonably comfortable in your hand and also give good leverage for cutting. They have a spring to hold them open and a flip lever to keep them closed for storage. These cutters have "Made in Japan" stamped on them and seem to be very nicely made overall, so I'm very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SJK

customer_reviews.title: Cuts bike cables like butter
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this wire cutter to use strictly on bike cables, but I'm sure they'd cut the slightly larger cables used on garage doors too. I had originally purchased cheaper wire cutters at Harbor Freight, that would just flatten and fray a bike cable. This heavy duty tool cuts cleanly and evenly, even after a half dozen cuts. Don't expect cheaper wire cutters to perform this well. These are reasonably priced, considering there are cutters that cost twice as much. Like others have stated, these are made in Japan.
customer_reviews.author: SHAWMAN

customer_reviews.title: Nice cutters for wire under 1/4
customer_reviews.text: I bought these cutters to see if they could handle 1/4" galvanized wire rope thinking it would be convenient to carry around a smaller set. It might be possible to cut 1/4" but the amount of force I was putting on these cutters seemed like it might break them. So for 1/4" leave it to 24 or 36 inch handle cutters. For everything else these cut nice and clean. I certainly will be keeping them in the toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: Donald G Snider

customer_reviews.title: Cuts Spiral Metal Corset Boning Like Butter!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I saw Gertie (Gretchen Hirsch) recommend this cutter on a tutorial for sewing in spiral metal boning. If you like to sew corsets, or just high quality retro clothing this is a must have tool! It cuts the spiral metal boning like butter. It will also easily trim any pointy bits sticking out. Thank you Gertie!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. S

customer_reviews.title: Cuts whatever the jaws will fit!
customer_reviews.text: Now THIS is a cutter! I'm 70 now and loosing my grip (in more ways than one, lol). This enables me to cut fencing and stranded cable that I couldn't before. It cuts clean and sharp and with about half as much effort from these old used up hands. I highly recommend these cutters if you need sharp clean cuts on anything up to 1/4" except tool steel. It cuts stainless, steel, brass and copper effortlessly. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: RalphCramden

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I had purchased another pair from another company that wore out within 5 or 6 cuts. These have held up so far. Glad to have found them. Research and check reviews before buying other brands.
customer_reviews.author: susanleigh80

customer_reviews.title: OMG....
customer_reviews.text: I transport food grade Oils and many shippers seal my various components with a stainless steel wire cable that does not cut easily with dikes. These are great!
customer_reviews.author: Buzz

customer_reviews.title: Yes, yes, yes!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this just so that I could cut a heavy duty accelerator cable on my '75 VW Beetle. It actually sells by the name "Bulletproof". - I tried my largest wire cutter, and a dremel cut-off wheel, but kept leaving frayed ends. Well, this wire cutter came today. I went out to the garage right away and went to work. One easy snip and perfection achieved. I can't wait for more things to cut.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Falcioni

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cutting wire rope without costing a fortune.
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to cut 1⁄8" wire rope when making a fence. Was shocked at the high prices and the large size of most of the tools recommended here, at Home Depot, and my local Ace for doing the job. Gave this Greenlee model a try and was very happy I did. The price is right, and it works great. Made perfect, clean cuts on the wire rope with minimal effort. Plus it's a nice compact size and fits well in my tool box.
customer_reviews.author: Reasoned Opinions

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, very clean cuts
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to cut eighth stainless steel aircraft wire rope to replace old deck spindles. Tried cutting wire with hand held cutting wheel on my grinder and couldn’t get clean cuts, took forever. Bought this and man what a difference. Very clean cuts and fit easily into crimping grommets. Made approximately 300 cuts and held up very well. Highly recommend this cutter for this type application.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan E.

customer_reviews.title: Greenlee 722 wire cutter
customer_reviews.text: I really love this tool but the hardware used to keep the halves together is a really poor choice. Greenlee should have used a bolt with a lower profile head and nut. The way it is right now it snags on everything, it's difficult to get in an out of the pouch. Other wise a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Great Wire Rope Cutter
customer_reviews.text: The Greenlee 722 Wire Rope Cutter is absolutely an excellent tool. It has made cutting wire rope seals a joy. These are very well made and worth every cent
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: useful tool
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to write a review to let other electricians know that this tool will cut 3/16 steel cable commonly used as guy wire on rigid steel service masts. If you are tired of gnawing on the stuff with your lineman's this is a good solution. Little cheaper than the knipex version, and I am not sure that those will accommodate 3/16 cable.
customer_reviews.author: f. bandersnatch

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed tool.
customer_reviews.text: I use this tool to clip tig wire. It works quite well up to 1/8”. Anything bigger it will not cut.
customer_reviews.author: Viking307

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. Cutting cables are so easy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Big John

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: Really nice cutters that leave a clean cut on nylon coated 3/16" cable. Tool appears to be quality build and Greenlee has a reputation for quality tools. I only use it occasionally so it should last me a lifetime.Not the cheapest but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: konaram

customer_reviews.title: Wow -- wish I'd bought this years ago
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure that this tool could cut steel cable and leave a clean, un-splayed end that I could stick into a cable-stud. It worked like a charm. All cuts were clean, leaving the cable end round and tight. Couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: OffGrid9Top Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Not better than $10 dollar wire cutter
customer_reviews.text: I thought that it would cut thicker wires than the ones that can be cut by the $10 cutter bought from Home Depot. It did not.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Cat

customer_reviews.title: Make the guy next to you with bolt cutters look bad. Coca Cola seals are a breeze to cut ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a trucker and this is a very handy tool for cutting cable seals. Make the guy next to you with bolt cutters look bad. Coca Cola seals are a breeze to cut and I've had no issues with these.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tool; Slow For My Purpose
customer_reviews.text: A well made tool that will cut through heavy wire, but it's not for cutting through major hardware cloth or welded wire fencing where a couple dozen cuts in a row are needed. The jaws have to fully open to engage the next wire-- a slow and fatiguing process.
customer_reviews.author: Garlics

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This cutter worked great on my ATV winch cable. instead a hammer and chisel. Nice clean cut,worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: J. Creasy

customer_reviews.title: Works good.
customer_reviews.text: Cuts 3/16 galv. Cable with ease. So far so good. Might be big for people with small hands to operate 1 handed. I can cut it 1 handed but ware a xl-xxl glove.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Superior Cutters, Well Worth Buying
customer_reviews.text: Best cutters for the 14 gauge wire I was stringing to make two 8'x40' espalier trellises. Made the job very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Like a hot knife through butter!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very glad I spent a little extra money for this quality tool. I'm using it to make several cuts in smaller 1/16" coated steel cable. This tool cuts effortlessly, and more importantly doesn't fray the cut end of the cable. The clean cuts make terminating cables a breeze! This is so much better than the end-snips and various other tools I tried using for the job.
customer_reviews.author: James J.

customer_reviews.title: Great little cable cutters.
customer_reviews.text: Great little cable cutters. I bought them to use for a project with 1/16th steel cable and the chomp right thru that no problem and leave a very clean cut, no problem getting it thru the sleeves and stops.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Boren

customer_reviews.title: works great for opening box cars
customer_reviews.text: works great for opening box cars, cuts crimp cable locks up too 5/16 im guessing, over 1/4 inch takes some strength, hardened cutters show no wear after 2 months of use, in a pinch can be used to cut 1" wide banding in two bites.
customer_reviews.author: mike a

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Cutting a 5/32 dia stainless aircraft cable. A perfect nice clean cut. No fraying what-so-ever. Stays sharp over time, and holds up well. A high quality tool.
customer_reviews.author: Vulcaneer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I found that with moderate pressure this cutter would easily snip through roughly 1/4" vinyl-covered steel cable. Nice that it can do that at roughly half the price of the next size cutter.
customer_reviews.author: random observer

customer_reviews.title: Greenlee is a top tool builder, but this tool is no good!
customer_reviews.text: This cutter worked great for about 3 cuts then the bolt that holds it together started backing out and they will not cut any more poor quality tool!
customer_reviews.author: R H E Inc

customer_reviews.title: Cut, snip, SNAP!
customer_reviews.text: I've used these cutters on cable-type trailer door seals required on trailers going into Canada every week day for at least a year now, and they are still just as sharp and easy to use as the day they were shipped to me!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: great cutters for stainless wire rope
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at how well the it cut the stainless steel wire rope (cable) for a cable railing system that we were building. . . cuts super clean without fraying.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Best Cutters for Corseters
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to cut steel for corsets. It cuts so much easier that what i was using and i dont get as much hand fatigue if i cut multiple.
customer_reviews.author: Emma H

customer_reviews.title: this tool cuts fast and great
customer_reviews.text: greenlee makes great products and this is just another one!
customer_reviews.author: penn

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Use this almost everyday to cut the heavy steel rope seals used on tanker trucks loads. Tried several other types of cutters that didn't hold for long, So far no problems with this pair of cutters!
customer_reviews.author: Scott McDonald

customer_reviews.title: ... trim 3/8" braided steel cable and this thing cuts like a dream
customer_reviews.text: I've used this at least twelve times to trim 3/8" braided steel cable and this thing cuts like a dream. Don't listen to the pussies commenting that this takes too much force to cut steel rope. For the size of it, it cuts cable super easy and is a skookum choocher.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher Schriock

customer_reviews.title: Great for cutting 1/8 Galvanized Steel Wire Rope
customer_reviews.text: I cut about 10 cuts of 1/8 Galvanized Steel Wire Rope it made quick work of it. Which was a major relief since I had worn a hacksaw blade down to smooth cutting just 2 strands...plus a nasty blister. Quality cutters for a Joe.
customer_reviews.author: CheeseAndRice

customer_reviews.title: but clean cut and great on 1/8 and
customer_reviews.text: hard cutting 3/16, but clean cut and great on 1/8 and smaller
customer_reviews.author: rwssi

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: These work great and cut with zero frey. I am so in love with these I have slept with them on more than one occasion. I would however suggest that you be careful if you do the same.
customer_reviews.author: Pink Spoon Art

customer_reviews.title: I started by using bolt cutters but they didn't leave the cable in good enough shape to put crimps on
customer_reviews.text: Makes cutting cable so much easier. I started by using bolt cutters but they didn't leave the cable in good enough shape to put crimps on. Makes installing support cables a whole lot easier. So far it is staying sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Camp Cook

customer_reviews.title: This cutter works quite well. None of my other ...
customer_reviews.text: This cutter works quite well. None of my other tools, including a hack saw could not cut the coated 3/16" cable.
customer_reviews.author: Simonb

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: A little pricy but an absolutely wonderful too that will last year's. Well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Hardy cutters
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to cut through spiral steel boning and and have since used it to cut through 10 gauge brass wire as well. Edges are nice and neat.
customer_reviews.author: Kensadi

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: This works great for the wire "seals" that many shippers are using to secure loaded trailers. They will cut right through the braided wires with very little fraying. Much better than wire or bolt cutters.
customer_reviews.author: John Wise

customer_reviews.title: Easily cuts through aircraft cable
customer_reviews.text: Easily cuts through 1/8-inch - 3/16-inch vinyl coated galvanized wire rope (aircraft cable). I have made less than a dozen cuts so far, but it shows no signs of wear so far, so I think it should last awhile.
customer_reviews.author: PETER M BRIDGE

customer_reviews.title: Good for cable, not hardened wire
customer_reviews.text: The main reason I bought these was for cutting heavy gauge music wire, but they don't live up to the claim of cutting 2.4mm thick stock. I immediately tried them on a piece of 1.3mm wire, and while they were technically able to cut it, this left the edge of the cutters permanently gouged. Now I always heat the spot I'm cutting until it glows and then let it air-cool first, softening the metal so that the jaws aren't damaged. On the bright side the cut ends are clean and square- not pinched like with bolt cutters -and they work great for bicycle cables and housing.
customer_reviews.author: dend

customer_reviews.title: Time will tell if they dull from all the cuts I need to make (~40)
customer_reviews.text: They cut 1/8 stainless steel wire rope no problem! No deformation/crushing of the strands which is what I was leery of. Time will tell if they dull from all the cuts I need to make (~40). If they dull out I'll update my review.
customer_reviews.author: timothy

customer_reviews.title: Wire rope cutter
customer_reviews.text: This has worked beautifully to cut 1/8 stainless wire rope, which would be quite difficult to cut otherwise. It is well made, and if taken care, should last well.
customer_reviews.author: Edward O. Wolcott

customer_reviews.title: Tool cuts seals good but don't trim the loose ends that unravel as ...
customer_reviews.text: Tool cuts seals good but don't trim the loose ends that unravel as clean as I would like. Always leaves a few stragglers that you have to cut again. The work fine for the initial cut on 3/32 steel cable seals as long as the strands are tight together.
customer_reviews.author: randy gibson

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality. Used it on the seals on trailers trucking. Cuts right thru the cables with ease. Sure beats using a hammer and snippers.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: cuts wire great. I purchased to cut field fence I am using to cage my vegetables with.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good price and was delivered on time. Cutters work great excellent tool
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Wire and Rope Cutter
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. The opening is a little small for cutting an old chicken wire fence, but it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These cutters cut through car seals on rail cars like butter. I am very pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Do a much better job than the ones my company supplies and has outlasted them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cutter! It works very well, even with my hands not having the strongest grip. Fabulous value, especially for the price listed.
customer_reviews.author: Bamrz

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sharp!
customer_reviews.text: Great product...I've been through all my friends' toolboxes and no one has wire cutters that work! This Greenlee 722 got the job done: I was cutting steel bicycle brake cables and needed a clean cut to thread through the protective casing. The protective casing is vinyl-coated 1/8th inch aluminum, which this cutter also cut mostly well. It bent the ends a bit, and took multiple tries, but I think that's because of the spiral structure of the casing. Since I'm not sure if it's the structure of that cable or the cutters themselves, I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5. Hopefully it holds out over the years.
customer_reviews.author: M Strong

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Very well made. They cut nice and clean.
customer_reviews.author: A reader

customer_reviews.title: Great tool! I couldn't believe I didn't have a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great tool! I couldn't believe I didn't have a tool to cut the wire for the task at hand.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Souza

customer_reviews.title: Great for truck drivers!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a tanker truck driver. Perfect for even the 1/4 in seals shippers sometimes use. Does the same job as Kleins but cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Nate in Iowa

customer_reviews.title: Greenlee makes some of the best tools I’m sure these will be awesome and if ...
customer_reviews.text: Greenlee makes some of the best tools I’m sure these will be awesome and if not I’m sure they’ll replace them thanks
customer_reviews.author: J.R. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Cutter is OK
customer_reviews.text: I have used this to cut 1/8 inch stainless wire. It does an OK job at this but that would be its limit. I don't think it would work well on 3/8 inch stainless.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Works great, could cut a little better
customer_reviews.text: Works great , could cut a little better , but overall not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory  Todd

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to cut some stainless steel cable and these did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: John Mincks

customer_reviews.title: Worked great.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Cut my 1/8" coated galvanized cable very cleanly.
customer_reviews.author: JDM

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed and a good
customer_reviews.text: Cuts wire rope. Just what I needed and a good price
customer_reviews.author: K. Shorrock

customer_reviews.title: Cuts tough steel cables like cutting AIR!
customer_reviews.text: Greenlee cuts tough steel cable as if it were only cutting air! I pull chemical tankers and never worry about cutting any seals with Greenlee, with one hand. By far, the best cable cutters you can buy...
customer_reviews.author: WillT

customer_reviews.title: Needs alot of force
customer_reviews.text: It works ok but does require alot of force to cut through the wire. Tthe handles should be longer to make it easier to cut.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Anger

customer_reviews.title: I'm Happy With Tool
customer_reviews.text: I use them to cut cable at work..nice clean cut.
customer_reviews.author: Doretha Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: Finally bought a dedicated wire rope cutter...after using this cutter, I regret waiting so long. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: David F. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, exactly what I wanted. Very quick delivery!
customer_reviews.author: teri

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: This tool made a BIG job cutting a lot of wire rope easy. The ends were cut clean without any fraying!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: oooooo buddy!
customer_reviews.text: its works great, brand new and handsome! don't let that darn little latch at the bottom catch you when youre cutting. Got me in the belly, tore skin and heavy bruising. Months later I say that its my gunshot scar. Beware!
customer_reviews.author: WildFire

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Tool works great cutting stainless wire rope No frayimg . quality tool
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wont do the job.
customer_reviews.text: It seems to me that if you make a tool with this size handle it should be able to cut with just using your hands. Nope. Could not get this to cut 5/32 stainless cable with my hands had to use some pipe to extend the handles. Even then couldn't get a clean cut. I HATE buying crap that doesn't work properly!
customer_reviews.author: J. Stocker

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tool for cable rail installation. I haven't used it much, but so far it cuts without much effort.
customer_reviews.author: Naturistboi

customer_reviews.title: BETTER THAN GRIPPLE
customer_reviews.text: I have always used GRIPPLE cutters but these out perform my stolen gripple ones Apart from that i am a Celtic Supporter and bought them for the green handles
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. Devlin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping, cutters new in package as described and they work great thanks
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Santangelo

customer_reviews.title: From my perspective these are a great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as advertised. I needed these cutters to snip braided cables for the airplane I'm building. These cutters performed flawlessly in the 4 or 5 times I've used them. From my perspective these are a great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pfarr

customer_reviews.title: Worth it to buy the right tool for the job
customer_reviews.text: Saved our life. We were using dykes(side cutters) to cut thin wire but it was deforming it and making it hard to thread thru eye screw. Really makes you understand how important the right tool is. Well made and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: DebbyLA

product_meta.title: Greenlee 722 Wire Rope & Wire Cutter
product_meta.description:
Greenlee proudly employs the United States workforce in seven manufacturing facilities, where we design, assemble and manufacture certain products which meet the rigorous made in the USA or qualifying statements. We encourage consumers to consult our product packaging or marketing materials found on greenlee to understand the origin of particular products.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Greenlee 722 cutter is designed specifically to cut small diameter steel wire and wire rope, including aircraft cable. The blades are made from forged steel and are hardened specifically to cut steel. The 722 is less than 8-Inch (200 mm) long and it weighs only 3/4-Pound. (0.34 kg), so it's very handy to use and fits easily in a tool pouch.
feature_bullets: Cuts soft wire rope up to 1/4 in. (6mm); cuts aircraft cable up to 3/16" (5mm); cuts hard steel wire up to 3/32" (2.4mm); cuts copper/aluminum cable up to 15/64" (6mm).
Heavy-duty forged steel blades and handles
Heat treated, precision ground, shear action cutting blades

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
